results.title: Three men made history
results.creator_credit: British Gas Council, Ace Films, Frank Green and John Miller
results.brief_description: The history of minting money in Great Britain. Special emphasis is laid on the work of Boulton, Watt and Murdock, and contemporary processes are shown in detail. The film has reproductions of ancient coins, with special emphasis on findings in Great Britain. The famous Maundy money distributed yearly by the King is also included.

results.title: Three little words
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description: Tin Pan Alley’s legendary songwriting team of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby are given the MGM treatment here by Busby Berkeley and musical stars Fred Astaire and Red Skelton, although the film is as much about the performances of the stellar cast as it is about the lives of Kalmar and Ruby. It’s 1919 and vaudeville is in full swing. Bert’s (Astaire) dance career is going well (despite his aspirations to be a musician), ably supported by vaudeville wife Jessie (Vera-Ellen), and obtaining success with numbers such as “Mrs and Mrs Hoofer at Home”. Fate steps in when Bert must take up the more sedentary activity of writing lyrics after injuring his knee. He eventually meets Harry Ruby, a fellow lyricist and frustrated baseball player, and the two pool their talents and reach immediate success writing hits for Broadway and the movies. Their fairytale rise to fame is eventually undone by a trivial misunderstanding, and highlights the rocky nature of their professional and personal relationship. Their future as a successful songwriting team is left in the hands of the women who love them, and who have the potential to reunite them. Cameos are provided by Phil Regan and Harry Mendoza as themselves. Songs include “I Wanna be loved by you”, “Who’s sorry now” and “Thinking of you”.

results.title: Three little kittens
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Arthur Gates and Ernest Horn
results.brief_description: A farmer’s wife discovers three little kittens with their mother in the barn. When they are two weeks old, the mother cat carries them to a new home in an old buggy, where they learn to feed and clean themselves and to play. As they grow, they meet other animals and learn to catch mice. Two of the kittens are given to local tradesmen to catch mice in their shops while the third stays on the farm with its mother to help catch mice in the barn.

results.title: Three girls at the UN
results.brief_description: The United Nations, an international organisation, is exemplified in the activity of three UN girl guides during one day. An Indonesian, an American and an Iranian are seen performing their duties at the UN building in New York and participating in social activities; a similar life to the 140 other international civil servants.
